events.name: Map up - lets map the neighborhood
events.description:
Hi all,

Come join us in adding our favorite places to google maps, hiking trails, cycling routes, restaurants or whatever else you care to have on a map. Map your usual places you love to make them visible to people of similar interests, and find new such places mapped by others..

We will intro map maker, what it is, how to use it, etc before starting the mapping.

Join in for the mapping, pizza, coffee, and socials.﻿

Map up - lets map the neighborhood

events.name: Exploring Google BigQuery
events.description:
Come join us explore Google BigQuery:
https://developers.google.com/bigquery/

We will do an intro, and demo with some sample data. You can bring your own data and explore what BigQuery allows you to do with it.

Requirements on what to bring and what to have setup on your laptop will be provided closer to the time..﻿

Exploring Google BigQuery

events.name: Scaleconf post workshop - App Engine
events.description:
Hi all,

There will be a post conference workshop on app engine, come join us ;)  We will be presenting an intro on Google App Engine in python, walking the audience through a sample app, discuss real world costs and projects out in the wild, walk through using the cloud endpoints feature of Google App Engine using a sample android app which will connect to our sample App Engine app. We will then have a workshop inviting attendees to pull down our sample apps from github, and we'll present a list of tasks which they can add onto our sample app, and compete to win a prize at the end.

Venue: 88mph, Block A, 4th floor, 66 Albert, Woodstock.

Looking forward to working in the tablecloth.., I mean cloud ;)﻿

Scaleconf post workshop - App Engine

events.name: Android hackathon - Joint GDG/android user group event
events.description:
Hi all,

Come join us hack a real world android app. The app will be one that submits traffic offences to: http://m.safelyhome.westerncape.gov.za/reporter
We have asked for an api endpoint for the mobi site, but in the event it is not available, we'll use a mock app engine endpoint to submit against. The app will prompt for the same info which the mobi site prompts, and make http calls to submit an offence. The app will make for a nice hands-on with android, and perhaps something useful if we can motivate for the api with the app as proof of concept once built.

Venue: 88mph, 4th floor, Block A, 66 Albert Woodstock.﻿

Android hackathon - Joint GDG/android user group event

events.name: Map Up - part 2
events.description:
Hi all,

Come join us in adding our favorite places to google maps, hiking trails, cycling routes, restaurants etc. Map your usual places you love to make them visible to people of similar interests..

More info here:
mapups | mapyourworldcommunity﻿

events.name: Google I/O 2014 extended livestream in Cape Town

venue.name: 22seven Theatre
venue.address_1: 60 Hout St, Corner of Long and Hout streets

events.description:
Join us live stream Google I/O 2014's keynote and day 1, chat with other developers, socialize, and have dinner, on June 25.
(https://www.google.com/events/io)

Agenda:
5pm - 6pm Snacks/Pizza drinks and chat, registration, find your seat, make yourself comfy
6pm - 8pm Livestream Google I/O keynote
8pm - 9pm Drinks/socials

Let the I/O magic happen, again. :)﻿

events.name: Android demos and social - let's build the android movement in Cpt
events.description:
Hi all,

Come join us in some demos (you are invited to demo too) 

a) connect with android developers in Cpt 
b) Watch some demos of things people are building and doing on android locally
c) demo your android app for others to see :)

and socials to connect the android developers of Cpt. The GDG wants to gather the forces, and hear from people about what they want out of android events, and help build and grow the android community in Cpt.

Snacks and drinks will be provided.

The venue will be confirmed closer to the time.﻿

Google + page

For those choosing to demo:
- keep it 5-10 minutes long
- describe your app, playstore links if applicable
- describe android features used in app, and your favorite one
- show snippets of code if you want to, or screenshots etc
- take a minute or 2 to answer some questions ;)
- come to the event 20-30 mins early, to test your setup and projector and network etc﻿

events.name: Material design with android

venue.name: 22seven Theatre
venue.address_1: 60 Hout St, Corner of Long and Hout streets

events.description:
+Alex Koller from 22Seven will introduce the new Android Material Design. This will be a short talk type event, come learn how to adapt your Android Apps to the new Material Design.

Alex is the developer behind the Cape Town MyCiti App, so come learn and socialize with other Android enthusiasts at this meetup.(https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.apkola.myciti)﻿

Google plus: http://goo.gl/owtF6K

events.name: All things Lollipop
events.description:
+Alex Koller, +maia grotepass & +Trilbi Resnik take us through a sprinkling of Android Lollipop topics.

- What's new in Lollipop

- Lollipop UI/design

- Upgrading your app to Lollipop

- Android Wear: the future

- Intro to next talk

What would you like to know?

We’ll finish by introducing our first talks lined up for next year. 

If there’s a topic you’d like to know more about, or you have cool tech to demo, this is the forum to let us know - we'd love to match interests with speakers.﻿

events.name: Visualizing opencellid.org data in realtime with the google cloud platform
events.description:
Come join us in a google cloud platform demo, have your questions about the google cloud answered, or share your experiences with us. Come chat to us about what google cloud events you want us to arrange in the year ahead too!

This is a repeat of the demo done at the AfricaCom conference.

We will demo and talk through how we've imported all of opencellid.org's data (tens of GB) into google bigquery, and used App Engine and google maps to do heatmaps of the timesliced data, querying massive datasets in seconds, and updating the heatmap.

We will also be giving out offline documentation on google cloud and android, bring 30GB free space if you would like them, more info here:

http://googledevelopers.blogspot.com/2014/12/bandwidth-challenged-amazing-google.html

Venue: 24.com (5th floor, 11 Adderley street, Cape Town)

Snacks will be provided.﻿

events.name: Go programming language - An intro and hands on

venue.name: IO offices, Old Castle Brewery
venue.address_1: Unit 414, Old Castle Brewery, Beach Road, Woodstock. At the IO offices: http://io.co.za/

events.description:
Have you been meaning to try Go?

Come join us hear about one developers experience porting to Go, an intro to the language, and a session to get hands-on with a hello world in Go.

We'll also have a look at Go on App Engine.

See you there :-)﻿

You can follow the Google Plus page on the link below
http://goo.gl/mqNT7Q

events.name: Google I/O 2015 Extended viewing party Cape Town

venue.name: 22seven Theatre
venue.address_1: 60 Hout St, Corner of Long and Hout streets

events.description:
Let's gather to eat and watch what exciting announcements come out of Google I/O 2015! :)

More details will be updated closer to the time.﻿

You can also follow this event on the Google Plus page http://goo.gl/vqacqN

events.name: Android For Beginners

venue.name: University of The Western Cape
venue.address_1: Life Sciences Bldg, Modderdam Rd, University of The Western Cape

events.description:
Requirements: Your laptop with android studio setup, working emulator or real device (please test that studio can see your real device before hand).

Please setup android studio as per: 

https://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html

If you are unable to get android studio setup, arrive around 1 hour early for the event, we will help you setup so that you are ready to rock by the time the event kicks off.

Also please note: to get the most out of this event, you need to know your way around Java. You need to be comfortable with the syntax and do basic debugging.

============

This meetup is for members who are interested in writing their first Android App.

We are going to touch on the basics of Android, from idea to conception.

Things we will cover :

1. Prototyping your idea before coding 

2. Using prototyping tools 

3. Activities 

4. Fragments 

5. Integrating libraries 

6. Asynchronous networking in Android

By the end of the meetup you should feel confident to tackle new Android projects. We will post the link to the Play Store of the App we will be building.﻿

Google+ page:  https://goo.gl/E3Hg8n

events.name: Android workshop for beginners
events.description:
Venue:  Class A118,Arts Building, Upper Campus, UCT

Requirements: Your laptop with android studio setup, working emulator or real device (please test that studio can see your real device before hand). If you have an android device, being your micro-USB cable too.

Please setup android studio as per: https://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html

Also get the support library and update the tools as outlined here:

https://developer.android.com/sdk/installing/adding-packages.html

If you are unable to get android studio setup, arrive early for the event, we will help you setup so that you are ready to rock by the time the event kicks off.

Also please note: to get the most out of this event, you need to know your way around Java. You need to be comfortable with the syntax and do basic debugging.

============

This meetup is aimed at beginners, it will cover some of the basics of building an android app.

We are going to touch on the basics of Android, from idea to conception.

Things we will cover :

1. Prototyping your idea before coding 2. Using prototyping tools 3. Activities 4. Fragments 5. Integrating libraries 6. Asynchronous networking in Android

By the end of the meetup you should feel confident to tackle new Android projects. We will post links of the slides and code used to work on after the event if you could not complete everything in the short time we have.

events.name: Intro to Docker and using it on Google Compute Engine
events.description:
Note: due to the Google dev summit (https://events.withgoogle.com/sub-saharan-africa-google-developer-summit-2015/) we had to shuffle resources. Therefore this event will be a workshop only, the talk will come in a later event.

Venue: codex offices, Workshop 17.

This event is  a workshop.

-------
Workshop requirements: bring your laptop, install the google cloud sdk as outlined here: https://cloud.google.com/sdk/
Having Docker installed locally always help, use this guide: https://docs.docker.com/installation/
Setup a project on the google developers console: https://developers.google.com/console/help/new/
(just the parts to setup your project), check that you can launch a compute engine instance, then you are good to go.
-------

The workshop
===========

We will explore using Docker.

We will deploy a  Docker image to Google Compute engine.

events.name: Android workshop - material design
events.description:
Find all the details on the g+ page

https://plus.google.com/events/ceb9vnoee8a1ik3rkburmcamp70

events.name: Android for beginners study jam Cape Town

venue.name: io
venue.address_1: 31 Loop St, Cape Town City Centre, Cape Town, 8000, South Africa

events.description:
NOTE:

• The study jam runs each Sat from April 2 until May 7.

• To get the most out of this jam you need to be able to come to most if not all events

• This jam is for android beginners, the material is for people starting out on android

• If you RSVP and later cannot commit to most events, please de-register and allow someone who can attend all events to take your place (If you miss a few sessions you won't benefit from this jam, we will run more in future).

• The jam involves homework, you will get practical work to do in the week, and meet sessions are about discussing, helping and explaining the weeks work, you need to be able to take time in the week to do the coursework to get the most out of the meet sessions.

• You need to be comfortable with Java, this jam will not cover the language, but rather will focus on android, be very comfortable with java before signing up for the jam to get the most out of it.

A big thank you to IO (io.co.za) for the venue and coffee for our study jam.

First event:

We will meet and greet each other, and help setup android studio and SDK's for participants (please bring your laptop). We will also hand out the material to be covered for the week ahead. We will discuss the course outline and lay out the coursework for the week ahead. The study jam involves practical work on android during the week, and at each session we will gather to discuss our experiences, help explain things in the coursework, and further those who may be stuck.

events.name: Android for beginners study jam Cape Town

venue.name: io
venue.address_1: 31 Loop St, Cape Town City Centre, Cape Town, 8000, South Africa

events.description:
For anyone attending for the first time, the entrance is the brown door next to the bikers cafe, there is a little intercom and GDG sign, hit the intercom for IO. Please bring laptops to events, we will do some prac at every event.

NOTE:

• The study jam runs each Sat from April 2 until May 7.

• To get the most out of this jam you need to be able to come to most if not all events

• This jam is for android beginners, the material is for people starting out on android

• If you RSVP and later cannot commit to most events, please de-register and allow someone who can attend all events to take your place (If you miss a few sessions you won't benefit from this jam, we will run more in future).

• The jam involves homework, you will get practical work to do in the week, and meet sessions are about discussing, helping and explaining the weeks work, you need to be able to take time in the week to do the coursework to get the most out of the meet sessions.

• You need to be comfortable with Java, this jam will not cover the language, but rather will focus on android, be very comfortable with java before signing up for the jam to get the most out of it.

A big thank you to IO (io.co.za) for the venue and coffee for our study jam.

Events:

At each event we will:

• Discuss the previous weeks material

• Share experiences, ask questions, help each other past any issues etc

• Practice by going through the practice sessions of the course, or other practice based off the material covered in the previous week

• Hand out the coming weeks material to be watched and studied by participants throughout the coming week.

events.name: Let's explore the google cloud platform

venue.name: io
venue.address_1: 31 Loop St, Cape Town City Centre, Cape Town, 8000, South Africa

events.description:
Venue: IO (31 loop street, Cape Town city center). 31 loop on the road looks like Jason's bakery, on the left of the bakery there is a brown door with an intercom, ring the IO button on that intercom. Go through the brown door all the way up to IO.

Join us celebrate GCP Next (the recent conference around google cloud platform) and learn about some of the products announced. We will have talks (see below descriptions) and code labs to get started with. We will also watch some recorded sessions from GCP Next, and sessions will be available to copy to take home and watch later. 

Talks:

--

Making sense of images using the Vision API from Google (Johann Du Toit)

Join me as we go through the recently released vision API that will allow a new class of apps to built on top of Google's AI, trained in this case for images.
We will be covering what the Vision API is, examples for using it, what data you might get from the API and have a live demo to try out while you're at the event to browse through all the delicious data returned and get your ideas flowing.

--

Angular 2 by Example (Sergey Akopkokhyants and Nadeen Southgate)

Quick step-by-step guide on how to develop web, mobile and desktop applications with Angular 2
--

An intro to Docker and Kubernetes (Hiren Patel)

Docker and kubernetes, what is all the fuss about, and how do I get started with it?

--

A big thanks to IO for the venue and coffee :-)

Give us comments on what you'd like to see talks or code labs on, and what interests you. Also let us know if there are specific sessions from GCP Next we can download for you to take and watch later.

events.name: Google I/O Extended viewing party Cape Town
events.description:
Join us to watch the keynote livestream day 1 of Google I/O 2016.

We will gather before the keynote starts, enjoy some beer and pizza while networking, and then watch the keynote together.﻿

events.name: Android mixed bag talks
events.description: Join us for an evening of Android talks from some of Cape town's best Android developers and a chance to network over pizza.  It will be an evening of various short talks on topics such as vector drawables, location awareness, value propositions and more.  Bring your friends and colleagues to join us as we discover more about Android.

events.name: Android Monthly talks - Android storage options
events.description:
We will delve into the world of storage in Android with talks about Realm, ORM libraries and Firebase Databases.

Bring your friends and colleagues to join us as we discover more about Android storage.

events.name: Google Hashcode hub at IO

venue.name: io
venue.address_1: 31 Loop St, Cape Town City Centre, Cape Town, 8000, South Africa

events.description: GDG Cape town in partnership with IO will be hosting a Google Hashcode hub where teams will be able to compete in the Hashcode competition. Particapants will need to register their team on https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/ by the 20th of February.

events.name: GCP Next live viewing day 1

venue.name: io
venue.address_1: 31 Loop St, Cape Town City Centre, Cape Town, 8000, South Africa

events.description:
Next '17 will be the largest event in Google's history. Google Cloud engineers. Customers and partners will gather for inspiration and hands-on experiences with tools, technologies and services born in the Cloud, including the latest developments from Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Maps and Devices.

Join us in the evening to watch the live stream and have a drink with the local Google community of developers interested in Google Cloud.

The schedule for the evening:
* Doors open at 6 PM, giving everyone an hour to network and chat
* Keynote starts at 7 PM till 8:30 PM
* Doors close at 9 PM every night

Snacks/drinks provided, so if you are in the neighborhood feel free to join and watch the latest Google Cloud announcements with friends.

Hosted at:

31 Loop St, Cape Town City Centre, Cape Town, 8000, South Africa, Cape Town

3rd Floor else ring the buzzer with the IO logo

events.name: I/O Extended 2017
events.description: Join us to watch the live streaming of the Google IO 2017 Keynote speech where google will announce the latest developments and innovations they will be releasing.

events.name: What's new in Android?

venue.name: Luno
venue.address_1: 3rd Floor, Hamilton House, 30 Chiappini St, De Waterkant

events.description:
Join us for an evening of talks about new and exciting Android development technologies. Speakers will be covering topics such as Architecture Components, Kotlin, Android Things, Adaptive Icons, Transitions and more.

More details about presenters and their respective topics to follow.

We hope to see you there, for an evening of interesting Android presentations and discussions! Drinks and snacks will be provided.
events.how_to_find_us: Arrive at Hamilton House in De Waterkant. Walk through the Chiappini Street entrance. Take the lift or the stairs to the 3rd floor. You will be let in to the Luno office and shown to the presentation area. Parking can be found on street.

events.name: Android Things: Workshop - Build your own Motion Sensor Lights & Camera
events.description:
GDG Cape Town and GDG Johannesburg are teaming up to offer an exciting Android Things session!

Android Things is an extension of the Android platform for IoT and embedded devices, writing IoT apps has been made a lot easier using Android Things. In this workshop, we will first cover what Android Things is and some basic examples of how to use it and then we will go onto building a light powered by motion sensor. Then you will learn to build a motion sensing camera that will take images and send them to your phone.

Please note we will have Android Things kits and all the required peripherals needed for development.

IMPORTANT: You will just need to bring a laptop that has Android Studio 3.0 beta 6 (or higher) installed on it. See here for how to get the Android Studio preview: https://developer.android.com/studio/preview/index.html

You will be working in pairs as we have a limited number of kits available. As such, we are accepting a maximum of 30 attendees. Please only RSVP as attending if you are certain that you will be able to make it!

Light drinks and snacks will be provided.

events.name: Material Design in Practice
events.description:
Join us for an evening of presentations and discussion on Material Design.

Google's design language is an excellent guideline for UX/UI that makes sense and delights users. The spec is constantly growing and covers a wide variety of topics, including UI components, UX patterns, motion/animation, brand expressiveness and much more.

See more at:
https://material.io

Speakers will be covering topics on:
- The design side of Material Design and how it can impact positively your product
- The practical implementation (in the context of Android development) of Material Design

Basic drinks and snacks will be provided.

More details on speaker topics will be announced soon. RSVP so that you are notified!
events.how_to_find_us: Park on either Hudson or Waterkant street. Enter the Hamilton House entrance and make your way up to the 3rd floor using the lift/stairs. You will be let in to the offices.

events.name: In-app Billing on Android
events.description:
Join us for an evening of presentations on In-app Billing on Android.

Leveraging Google Play in order to monetize your Android app is a great way to build a business out of your new or existing digital product. Android offers a variety of ways to do this (now available in South Africa) which we will explore in this Meetup.

Speakers will be covering topics such as:
- In-app purchases
- Subscriptions
- Google Play Merchant Accounts

Light drinks and snacks will be provided.

Looking forward to seeing you all there!

events.name: Extend your apps: Building for Google Assistant & Chromecast
events.description:
We've often hosted Meetups that cover building apps for (Android) smartphones and tablets. This month we'll be covering a few ways to extend your apps to work with other Google platforms/services.

Topics will include:
- Actions on Google Assistant
- Apps for Chromecast

See you there!
events.how_to_find_us: Come through the Hamilton House street entrance, make your way up to the 3rd floor via the stairs or elevator

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Cape Town

venue.name: 22seven Theatre
venue.address_1: 60 Hout St, Corner of Long and Hout streets

events.description:
As is tradition, we will be hosting our annual Google I/O Extended viewing of the 2018 keynote speech!

There is bound to be loads of exciting announcements on topics such as Android, Firebase, Google Cloud, Google Assistant, Material Design, TensorFlow and more!

We will be live-streaming the keynote at the 22seven Theatre. The cinema screen is a great way to sit back and experience the keynote.

Drinks, snacks and perhaps a bit of swag will be provided to attendees.

See you there!
events.how_to_find_us: Park on Hout Street, Loop Street or anywhere nearby. Ring the 22seven doorbell at 60 Hout Street and you will be let in. Make your way up the stairs to the 22seven Theatre.

events.name: Google I/O 2018 Recap
events.description:
Google I/O 2018 has come and gone, and it brought with it loads of new exciting products and tools for developers and designers.

We will be hosting a recap of some of our highlights, in the form of presentations and a fireside chat.

Please see below our speakers for the evening:

Johan Nell from Over (new speaker!):
Architecture Components and the rewards/challenges of integrating these fast-changing libraries into your Android app

Alex Koller from Luno:
App Bundles and Google Play’s new app serving model, called Dynamic Delivery

Nick Rout from Over:
What's new in Material Design, including Material Theming, the Sketch plugin, Gallery and the Material Components libraries

We also have guest speakers from Flamelink (https://flamelink.io) who will be giving us a roundup of Firebase at I/O 2018. Andrew McElroy and Coenraad Fick will discuss some of the key takeouts from I/O as well as some of the new features and products announced that that will join the ever-increasing Firebase ecosystem.

Drinks, snacks and perhaps a bit of swag will be provided to attendees.

See you there!
events.how_to_find_us: Make your way up to the 6th floor of the 62 Roeland Street building (above Vida Cafe)

events.name: Machine Learning for Digital Product Builders
events.description:
We're excited to be hosting our first Machine Learning oriented event at GDG Cape Town!

Whether you're a developer, a designer, a manager or a seasoned ML expert, you're bound to learn something at our July event.

We have two awesome speakers who will be covering the fundamental concepts as well as practical implementations in your products/services, leveraging Google technologies such as TensorFlow and ML Kit:

Johann Du Toit
Google Developer Expert (GDE) for Google Cloud Platform

He will be covering:

Info he needed when he started doing Machine Learning work. There were *aha* moments throughout his failures, and his talk will try to condense those learnings.

-> What machine learning actually is, and is not; to level the playing the playing field.
-> The different types of models
-> How you would go about training a model with examples to each
-> How to run your awesome model

The aim of the talk is for the takeaway to be a structured mindset for those now newly approaching machine learning; be they developers/designers or product managers, will be able to walk away able to talk ML and know what to expect when being faced with a ML project.

For the experts, you might at least get to know a few new tools.

Expect realtime demos and some wackyness sprinkled in.

Rebecca Franks
Google Developer Expert (GDE) for Android

She will be covering:

An Android Developer's Guide to Machine Learning with ML Kit, TensorFlow and Firebase.

She will be going through an example app that detects whether or not a chip packet is the Nik Naks brand or not.

Core Machine Learning concepts, face/landmark detection, labelling, barcode scanning and more will be discussed and demoed.

This one is not to be missed, especially if you are involved in the Android Development field!
events.how_to_find_us: Park on the street near 62 Roeland Street. Enter the sliding doors to the left of the Vida Cafe. Use the lift or the stairs to make your way up to the 6th Floor.

events.name: Kotlin: The good, the bad and the ugly
events.description:
This month we look beyond the buzz of Kotlin and delve deeper into what are the caveats when making the change to Kotlin and if it is a language for more than just Android development.

If you are a developer wanting to make the change to Kotlin, then you will learn something new at our August event.

Speakers

Nick Rout (Android Developer and GDG Cape Town organiser)
Nick will give a small update on GDG Cape Town and as well as introduction to Kotlin basics.

Jacques Smuts (Android developer and GDG Cape Town co-organiser)
- *Java to Kotlin*. Jacques will be going through some of the issues you'll run into when converting legacy projects to Kotlin.

Wouter De Vos
Wouter will be talking on Databinding and Kotlin.

See you then...
events.how_to_find_us: Park on the street near 153 Loop street. Go through the double glass doors with the sign "flat circle" above.

events.name: Spooky Android: Google Pay, Chat Apps with Firebase and Material Design 👻🎃🍬

venue.name: Luno
venue.address_1: 3rd Floor, Hamilton House, 30 Chiappini St, De Waterkant

events.description:
On Halloween this month, we are hosting a "mixed bag" event focusing on Android development, Google Pay and Material Design.

We have three awesome speakers who will be covering different topics related to Google technologies.

*Alex Koller*
Google Developer Expert (GDE) for Android

Alex will give a presentation on Google Pay, and integrating it into your app.

*Nick Rout*
Android Engineer at Over

Nick will be covering an introduction to Material Design Tools and Components

*Adrian Bunge & Wisani Shilumani*
Developers at Nona

They'll be presenting a chat app "done right" with Android and Cloud Functions.

This night will have a little bit of everything and you'll be sure to learn something. Trick or treat!

events.name: A Happy New Year: DevFest, Microservices, IoT in GCP ☁️
events.description:
Happy New Year! We are kicking off 2019 with an event focused on GCP (Google Cloud Platform) ☁️

We'll also be recapping DevFest South Africa (https://devfest.co.za/) which took place in Johannesburg on December 1st 2018.

The schedule for the evening is as follows:

18:15 - Welcome and intro
18:25 - DevFest ‘18 recap
18:50 - From Monolith to Microservices (Dale Humby)
19:25 - A Primer on IoT with GCP (Reuben Honigwachs)
19:55 - Goodbyes

Dale Humby is CTO at Nomanini and a Google Developer Expert for Google Cloud. He will be speaking about Nomanini's journey from an App Engine monolith to microservices running on Docker and Kubernetes.

Reuben Honigwachs is a GCP Cloud Architect and GDG Cape Town co-organiser. He will talk about the current challenges with IoT and how products such as GCP Cloud IoT Core can help.

As usual, drinks, snacks and some swag will be provided for attendees. There is on-street parking in close proximity to the venue.

We hope to see you there!
events.how_to_find_us: Make your way up to the 6th floor of the 62 Roeland Street building (above Vida Cafe)

events.name: Android mixed bag: Location Services, WorkManager, Google Play Experiments 🗺️⚙️
events.description:
Our February Meetup will be covering interesting Android-related topics 🤖

The schedule for the evening is as follows:

18:15 - Welcome and intro
18:25 - Location background/foreground services (Adrian Bunge)
18:55 - Pizza break
19:10 - Working with WorkManager (Nick Rout)
19:35 - Google Play Experiments (Alex Koller)
20:00 - Goodbyes

Adrian Bunge is a Developer/Designer at Nona and GDG Cape Town co-organiser. He will be speaking about tracking user/device location while the app is: 1) open (in the foreground) and 2) closed (in the background). You can check out the two repo's that will form the basis for the talk here:
Android: https://github.com/olddustysocksunderthecouch/MultiLingualFamAndroid
Firebase Cloud Functions:
https://github.com/olddustysocksunderthecouch/MultiLingualFamCloudFunctions

Nick Rout is an Android Engineer at Over and the GDG Cape Town organiser. He will be speaking about WorkManager - the Android architecture component for deferrable, asynchronous background work: basic setup and usage of one-time and periodic work, incorporating dependency injection with Dagger and integrating with Kotlin Coroutines.

Alex Koller is head of Product at Luno, a Google Developer Expert for Android and a GDG Cape Town co-organiser. He will be speaking about running experiments on the Google Play Store and the value it can add to building digital products that users love.

As usual, drinks, snacks and some swag will be provided for attendees. There is on-street parking in close proximity to the venue.

We hope to see you there!
events.how_to_find_us: On-street parking available near the venue. Arrive at 62 Roeland Street (entrance on the left of Vida e Caffe) and make your way up to the 6th floor using the elevator or stairs. You will be let in to the event venue.

events.name: Flutter: Hello World, Dart Experiences & EskomSePush 🎯⚡

venue.name: Luno
venue.address_1: 3rd Floor, Hamilton House, 30 Chiappini St, De Waterkant

events.description:
Our March Meetup will be our first event covering Flutter topics, from speakers who have real world experience 🐦

The schedule for the evening is as follows:

18:15 - Welcome and intro
18:25 - Flutter Intro (Sylvia Dieckmann)
18:55 - Pizza break
19:10 - Flutter in EskomSePush (Dan Wells)
19:35 - Flitter Flutter with a dash of Dart (Ewald Horn)
20:00 - Goodbyes

Sylvia Dieckmann is a Developer at Praekelt.org and a GDG Cape Town co-organiser. She will be speaking about initial Flutter setup and will run through a simple Hello Flutter example app.

Dan Wells is a full-stack developer and co-founder of EskomSePush (a load shedding timetable app). He has also worked at various high-profile South African tech companies, such as Telkom, Entersekt and Takealot. He will be speaking about his experiences in using Flutter to develop the EskomSePush mobile app.

Ewald Horn is a mobile developer, with a special focus on the unique challenges of the African continent. He will be speaking about the lessons he learned in moving from Java and Kotlin to Dart and Flutter for his Android development.

As usual, drinks, snacks and some swag will be provided for attendees. There is on-street parking in close proximity to the venue.

We hope to see you there!
events.how_to_find_us: On-street parking available near the venue. Arrive at 30 Chiappini Street and make your way up to the 3rd floor using the elevator or stairs. You will be let in to the event venue.

events.name: Google Cloud Next '19 Extended ☁️📽️🍿
events.description:
It's this time of the year again. Google Cloud Next '19 is taking place April 9-11 in San Francisco. We'll be live streaming the keynote as a viewing party.

Please join us to check out and discuss the newest developments and announcements around Google Cloud Platform.

The schedule for the evening is as follows:

17:45 - Welcome
18:00 - Keynote
19:30 - Chat, connect, and goodbyes

As usual, drinks and snacks will be provided for attendees. There is on-street parking in close proximity to the venue.

We hope to see you there!
events.how_to_find_us: Park on the street near 153 Loop street. Ring at the double glass doors with the sign "flat circle". Be patient :-)

events.name: I/O Extended 2019 Cape Town
events.description:
We’re hosting our annual Google I/O Extended event on 7 May and we’ll live-stream the keynote from Mountain View, California! 📣📽️🍿

I/O Extended is a global event that allows developers from around the world to take part in the I/O Experience. We are proud to host an official Cape Town event.

For more information on I/O Extended see:
https://events.google.com/io/extended

We are extremely grateful to our sponsors for this year:

IO (drinks, snacks, general organising)
https://io.co.za/

The Honey Badger (venue)
https://91loop.co.za/the-honey-badger

Over (drinks, swag)
https://madewithover.com

The schedule for the evening is as follows:

18:30 - Welcome
19:00 - Keynote live-stream
20:30 - Chat, connect, drinks/snacks
21:00 - Goodbyes

As usual, drinks, snacks and a bit of swag will be provided for attendees. There is limited on-street parking in close proximity to the venue, but we recommend using a ride hailing service.

We hope to see you there!
events.how_to_find_us: Make your way to the event via ride hailing or your own transport. Make your way into The Honey Badger. You will be checked against your RSVP at the door to the venue as space is limited.

events.name: I/O Recap, Paging and Coroutines 🔄
events.description:
We hosted the Google I/O viewing event last month. Now we're recapping some of the announcements and technologies shown at I/O.

The schedule for the evening is as follows:

18:00 - Welcome
18:15 - Nick Rout recaps his experiences and noteworthy content from Google I/O
18:45 - George Ng'ethe presents an intro to the Android Paging library
19:10 - Break
19:30 - Jacques Smuts explains how to get into Kotlin Coroutines
20:00 - Goodbyes

As usual, drinks, snacks and a bit of swag will be provided for attendees. There is limited on-street parking in close proximity to the venue, but we recommend using a ride hailing service.

We hope to see you there!
events.how_to_find_us: Enter the sliding doors of 62 Roeland street, to the left of the Vida Cafe. Head up to the 7th floor via the lift or stairs.

upcoming.name: Kotlin/Everywhere South Africa
upcoming.description:
Note: this is a shared event between GDG Johannesburg and GDG Cape Town. It is listed on both Meetup groups to promote it our combined communities. However, please be aware that the event is only being held once in Johannesburg.

This is a series of community-led events, where you can learn the essentials and best practices of Kotlin in Android, Google Cloud Platform, and multi-platform development.

Kotlin is a modern and statically typed programming language targeting the JVM, Android, JavaScript & Native that will boost your productivity and increase your developer happiness.

The event is a bit different from other conferences. We want to make it accessible so we aren't charging a fee to attend. There are only 100 spots so you need to really give some good motivation as to why you want to be there.

APPLY TO ATTEND HERE:
http://bit.ly/kotlin-everywhere-jhb

NOTE: RSVPing ON MEETUP DOES NOT MEAN YOU HAVE A TICKET TO ATTEND.

Keen to speak? Apply here:
http://bit.ly/kotlin-everywhere-jhb-speak

Want to sponsor? Contact us on [masked], we would love to chat!

organizers.name: Nick R.
organizers.bio: Android Engineer at Over | Google Developer Expert for Android | GDG Cape Town Organizer | 🌚

group_profile.intro: Hi, I'm Nick. I'm an Android Engineer at Over and Organizer for GDG Cape Town. I'm interested in hosting and attending tech- and design-based meetups.
